messages.messageBody:
-=-Also, does anyone know of cheap airlines? -=-

CNN had a story yesterday about Delta slashing it's prices by 50% and
that other airlines might follow suit. So keep your eyes open...it
could get pretty cheap!!

Sarah

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Live and Learn Conference Hotel Info
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/4/2005 10:49:35 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, bluebell@megalink.net writes: YAY! I  just booked a suite for the family and I m trying to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/4/2005 10:49:35 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
bluebell@... writes:

YAY! I just booked a suite for the family and I'm trying to figure out which
airport is
closest... Also, does anyone know of cheap airlines? We're coming from Maine
and there is
no way we could drive... my youngest can only last about two hours in the
car before she
freaks out!

Also, has anyone in the past crammed two families into one hotel room?<<<<<

Jessie, there are two airports: Lambert Field in St Louis and there's a
smaller airport in Mascoutah, IL----MidAmerica Airport. I'd try both to check out
your options.

You*can* cram two families in----but don't tell the hotel. It's against fire
regulations.

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Live and Learn Conference Hotel Info
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/5/2005 9:15:01 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, treegoddess@comcast.net writes: I was on  the main reservation line--an 800 number--so there
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/5/2005 9:15:01 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
treegoddess@... writes:

I was on the main reservation line--an 800
number--so there may be more luck with this by calling the
hotel itself for reservations.-=-



We made reservations last night directly with the hotel and got the
conference rate from the 5th through the 10th. I just received the confirmation #
this morning so we're set. Driving from Florida again...haven't even tried to
figure out the mileage. It's far but definitely worth it!

Gail

about four days after, and they wouldn't do it at the
conference rate. I was on the main reservation line--an 800

Thanks for the info. I'm going to call the hotel directly and we are
planning to stay there 5th-10th also. Mapquest says it's an eight and
a half hour drive from Detroit so I'm not expecting to be there any
sooner than a 10 hour ride. I like driving at night instead of during
the day so that should help some, too, I hope. :)

-Tracy-

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Live and Learn Conference Hotel Info
messages.msgSnippet: === What do you mean, Danielle?  Did they not want to give you the conference rate for a few more days? === They added a day on either side, but I wanted to
messages.messageBody:
=== What do you mean, Danielle? Did they not want to give you the
conference rate for a few more days? ===

They added a day on either side, but I wanted to extend about four days
after, and they wouldn't do it at the conference rate. I was on the main
reservation line--an 800 number--so there may be more luck with this by
calling the hotel itself for reservations.

--Danielle

http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Welcomehome.html


>
>

messages.subject: Live and Learn Conference Hotel Info
messages.msgSnippet: I have the hotel information for the 2005 Live and Learn Unschooling Conference. We will be just across the river from St Louis---actually in Illinois. We ll
messages.messageBody:
I have the hotel information for the 2005 Live and Learn Unschooling
Conference.

We will be just across the river from St Louis---actually in Illinois.

We'll be at the Four Points by Sheraton in Fairview Heights, IL. You can
check out the hotel at _http://www.starwoodhotels.com/fourpoints/index.html_
(http://www.starwoodhotels.com/fourpoints/index.html)

The Central Reservation number is 1-800-325-3535.
If you'd like to call the hotel directly: 1-618-622-9500.

Be sure to mention the Live and Learn Unschooling Conference in Fairview
Heights, IL to get our low, low conference rate of $80/night. There are a very
few suites at $110/night.

If you're planning to come a few days early or stay late, you can get the
conference rate extended by asking.

The conference will be FOUR days this year, due to popular demand! <G> So
we'll be starting on THURSDAY morning instead of Friday and going through
SUNDAY---so October 6th through the 9th, 2005.

I met with our web designer on yesterday to iron out the website, so that
should be up very soon. I'll post when it's up and running.

Looking forward to seeing you all there! And please feel free to cross-post
at other unschooling e-lists/sites.

~Kelly
